content:
Airbnb was born in 2007 when two Hosts welcomed three guests to their San Francisco home, and has since grown to over 4 million Hosts who have welcomed more than 1 billion guest arrivals in almost every country across the globe. Every day, Hosts offer unique stays and experiences that make it possible for guests to connect with communities in a more authentic way.The Community You Will Join: 
The AirCover team is charged with ideating, building, launching, and managing the AirCover business inside of Airbnb. We have a huge responsibility to our community of Hosts and guests to be there when things don’t go exactly as planned with their reservations. We have a lot of work to do in the coming years and we are looking for someone who will help us manage all of the things that need to be done to deliver best-in-class services to our community.
The Aircover Ops Operational Success Team, a vital part of Aircover Scaled Ops and Optimization, empowers our operations and cross-functional partners through talent development and sustainable solutions. We achieve this by developing and facilitating best practices, research, support, and training plans in collaboration with our Shared Services team, contributing to operational excellence, including partner BPOs, and cultivating lasting impactful operational excellence throughout the organization.
We are looking for an Operational Success Engagement Specialist who plays a pivotal role within our team fostering a thriving team culture within the Aircover organization. The role of Team Engagement Specialist is crucial in helping organizations create a positive and inclusive workplace culture, boost employee morale, and ultimately improve overall performance and retention.
The Difference You Will Make:
In the role of Operational Success Engagement Specialist, your mission is to empower our Aircover Ops team, including ACC and partner sites, with the essential capabilities, resources, mindsets, and behaviors needed to not only thrive but also excel in a rapidly growing business environment, even as we scale up by a factor of 10X. This role represents a critical pillar within Aircover, where we develop, enhance, and disseminate strategic operational capabilities throughout the organization. The ultimate goal is to foster deep engagement among our team members, amplify the influential capabilities of Aircover Scaled Ops, and ultimately achieve flawless end-to-end customer lifecycle management for all.

Communication Skills: Effective communication is paramount in this role. Specialists need to communicate with employees, leadership, and cross-functional teams to convey ideas, deliver training, and maintain communication channels effectively.
Interpersonal Skills: Building and nurturing relationships with employees, teams, and stakeholders is crucial for understanding their needs, fostering engagement, and organizing events.
Data Analysis: The ability to collect, analyze, and interpret employee feedback and survey data is essential for making informed recommendations, measuring program effectiveness, and identifying areas for improvement.
Diversity and Belonging (D&B)): Knowledge of D&B principles and strategies is increasingly important in today's workplace. Specialists must drive efforts to promote diversity, equity, and inclusion, creating an inclusive culture where all employees feel valued and respected.

A Typical Day: 

Employee Engagement Programs: Develop and implement strategies and programs to increase employee engagement, motivation, and satisfaction. This includes conducting surveys, analyzing feedback, and recommending action plans.
Cultural Assessment: Assess the organization's current culture, values, and employee sentiment to identify areas for improvement and alignment with the company's goals.
Training and Development: Collaborate with talent and Operation leadership to design and deliver training programs that support cultural initiatives, leadership development, and team-building efforts.
Communication: Create and maintain effective communication channels to ensure that employees are informed about organizational changes, initiatives, and culture-related activities. This includes hosting meetings, sending newsletters, and having good written communications via emails and slack. 
Diversity and Belonging : Drive efforts to promote diversity and inclusion within the global workplace. Develop and execute strategies to foster an inclusive culture.
Recognition and Rewards: Establish recognition and reward programs that acknowledge employee contributions and reinforce desired behaviors. Assure budget tracking. 
Employee Feedback: Collect and analyze feedback from employees through surveys, focus groups, and one-on-one interactions. Use insights to make data-driven recommendations for culture improvement.
Change Management: Assist in managing organizational change initiatives by providing support, communication plans, and strategies to help employees adapt. Also support prioritization framework for effective execution of the most impactful projects. 
Event Planning: Organize and coordinate events, activities, and initiatives that promote team building, social interaction, and a positive work atmosphere.

Your Expertise:

Bachelor's degree in Human Resources, Organizational Psychology, Business Administration, or a related field. 
1-3 years of experience in customer engagement, employee engagement or a related field
Proven experience in employee engagement, culture development, or a related field.
Strong understanding of organizational behavior, change management, and HR best practices.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
Analytical and data-driven mindset with the ability to use metrics to drive decision-making.
Creativity and innovation in designing engagement programs.
Knowledge of diversity, equity, and inclusion principles and practices.
Proficiency in HR software and tools for survey administration and data analysis.
Experience working in a fast-paced global and diverse environment 
Experience with project management software, such as Asana or Trello
Graphic design skills using presentation, newsletter creation tool

Your Location:
This position is US - Remote Eligible. The role may include occasional work at an Airbnb office or attendance at offsites, as agreed to with your manager. While the position is Remote Eligible, you must live in a state where Airbnb, Inc. has a registered entity. Click here for the up-to-date list of excluded states. This list is continuously evolving, so please check back with us if the state you live in is on the exclusion list. If your position is employed by another Airbnb entity, your recruiter will inform you what states you are eligible to work from.
Our Commitment To Inclusion & Belonging:
Airbnb is committed to working with the broadest talent pool possible. We believe diverse ideas foster innovation and engagement, and allow us to attract creatively-led people, and to develop the best products, services and solutions. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply.
We strive to also provide a disability inclusive application and interview process. If you are a candidate with a disability and require reasonable accommodation in order to submit an application, please contact us at: reasonableaccommodations@airbnb.com. Please include your full name, the role you’re applying for and the accommodation necessary to assist you with the recruiting process. 
We ask that you only reach out to us if you are a candidate whose disability prevents you from being able to complete our online application.How We'll Take Care of You:

Race & Ethnicity Definitions:

Hispanic or Latino: A person of Cuban, Mexican, Puerto Rican, South or Central American, or other Spanish culture or origin regardless of race.

White (Not Hispanic or Latino): A person having origins in any of the original peoples of Europe, the Middle East, or North Africa.

Black or African American (Not Hispanic or Latino): A person having origins in any of the black racial groups of Africa.

Asian (Not Hispanic or Latino): A person having origins in any of the original peoples of the Far East, Southeast Asia, or the Indian Subcontinent including, for example, Cambodia, China, India, Japan, Korea, Malaysia, Pakistan, the Philippine Islands, Thailand, and Vietnam.

Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander (Not Hispanic or Latino): A person having origins in any of the peoples of Hawaii, Guam, Samoa, or other Pacific Islands.

American Indian or Alaska Native (Not Hispanic or Latino): A person having origins in any of the original peoples of North and South America (including Central America) and who maintain tribal affiliation or community attachment.

Two or More Races (Not Hispanic or Latino): Persons who identify with two or more race categories named above.
